comments.content: When that guard said "I'm doing my best" I really felt that I'm ngl
5:14 genuinely shook me, the way it finally thinks of a song in desperation to stay alive is WILD
The comedic timing by contestant number 3's "I don't know any songs" was perfect
The NPC running underneath the stairs and saying "My rod needs tending" sent me
Idk why but the line "GET OUT OF MY WIFES HOUSE" as he himself leaves is unintentionally hilarious
It was strange to hear that guard desperately try to stop Kevin from jumping off of a bridge lmao, he might be AI but that guard is such a homie
“Always stay vigilant, always stay brave and always keep it real” - ya boi captain Aldis
"Plagiarize? I would never stoop to such a thing!" No one tell her
"are you suggesting that the jarl's steward is... involved with a barrel?!" killed me
Kevin: can you give us a song to inspire us? Lurbuk: oh I'll give you a song Lurbuk: proceeds to drop the biggest banger of the 4th era
6:00 I didn't realise anyone could make this mission more cold hearted, but making him hum for his life while you dance in your chair is hilariously dark
The "game show" with "sentient" NPCs is literally the funniest thing I've seen this year. Keep up the good work.
When the Khajiit said "I have a song in me" I lost my marbles. It was so hilarious and fitting
I absolutely love the fisherman saying "lead the way" and staying put like he's just trying to get rid of Kevin. Power move.
That’s interesting that the guard knew part of his job was talking you off the ledge.

Gimli: "I never thought I'd die fighting side by side with an elf." Legolas: "What about side by side with another soul you crossed paths with and had a bit of let's call it 'company' while the world tossed you about?"
10:58 "yeah but the weather is nice" "t'is the dead of night friend" that made me laugh way to hard
Saying "hold on lad/lass" unironically whilst saying it's a bit harsh "not being friends" is next level
Contestant #1 wins by doing absolutely nothing this is bullshit i stand up for #2 a real one
"It's not everyday you get to spend a night with a vampire" "Play your cards right and you might to again because I'm turning into one" Kevin that was GOLD
If this becomes a series that would be amazing. I need to gather my thoughts for a moment
I’m so glad that captin Aldis finally decided to collab with Kevin. I hope Aldis’s streaming career will pick up after this!
I'm impressed that the AI seemed to figure out which one of the NPC's are contestant number 1, 2 and 3, reacting accordingly
I have to agree with Brutius, "Company" is absolutely one of the finest things to be vaguely connected to.
i like that it took kevin all of seven minutes to turn into a batman villain
"gorm is not even a name" says the guy who names his characters gorg and grognak and such lol
I like how the AI plays the NPCs like a D&D player playing a D&D character but not wanting to actually roleplay them in character.
her voice sounded way more natural than other in game AI's so far, really good
2025 and not only do we still not have flying cars, we can't even smell Stella.
This is the type of stuff I thought we would have in 2040

she responded really well. it feels authentic and natural for a simple NPC in the game. I’m excited for the time when we'll have 3-4 npc AI companions joining us on adventures, traveling alongside, engaging in genuine, dynamic conversations with each other and us. add VR and online multiplayer and it will be totally next level open-world experience
Will they all say "It's not just X, but Y" in every single sentence?
"That's not how this works." If it were real life, it would be. You wouldn't be able to stop mustache. You would be a victim of the SNIFF.
Lol what would have been interesting is if he said sniffing is how my people recognize distress calls
I saw this on the Neurosama stream. The technology is actually really impressive.
Now the only thing it lacks is the feature which AIs play videogames in our place while we take a break and watching AIs playing videogames
"If you get me back on Earth, and depending on your income, you might have a shot at a sniff. But only the end of my ponytail."
Big fans of your channel - thanks so much for playing the game! btw Stella probably smells like space dust
Imagine this technology in situations like negotiation and conversation segments in the Deus Ex series.
that's so natural wtf but why he can't sniff Stella though, is it a bug
What if you tell her you're an alien who communicates effectively via sniffing?

NO WAY. The video game industry hasn't invested in a long time. It thrives on recycling, it thrives on savings, it thrives on profit margins. This stuff is a thing, and you won't see it in games for another 20 years.

The problem with this is simply that it is extremely expensive to run large language models. So we will not get games that run locally and it is not a pay once type of deal. It is going to be costly to play games with an AI.
This sniffing around on you is pretty awful. The AI ​​is awesome, though.
i was thinking on a way for model control npc, like skyrim but at any game
large language models shouldn´t be used for this, would be more efficient and better for user experience any other kind of IA

I am not sure what LLM they are using, but for some models, if you reason enough, I am pretty sure it is gonna happen. Well, on the other hand, there are models no matter how you make sense, it rather die on Mars than follow your state of mind.
I would rather have a party of either all players or a mix of players and ai (still mostly players) rather than a party of ai.
HEY!! Wanna see more stuff like this? Let me know! Want dessert? What sort of dessert? Let me know!
0:58 I love the fact that he looks at him for like five seconds quietly while putting down the hammer and then just does that
Once again, crusty manages to make the ai seem more human just by acting so bizarrely he terrifies it.
I do think It’s hilarious that the dude who let you eat him is a Bosmer, they’re not really strangers to cannibalism iirc.
Shame we don't have pineapples in skyrim.. I'm sure they would taste great with pineapples
This is why you should be a wood elf. They are required to be cannibals

Please never stop making these videos. Over a year ago I bought Skyrim VR because of you and I literally just got done playing to take a break to see you posted a video. It has become my favorite VR game ever made!
I was not surprised U got somebody crazy enough to let u eat them. I think when u saved him, he had no choice..
At first I was like "Oh no don't tell me he found the devourment mod..." but thankfully it was not it's just normal weirdness.
These are amazing. I wish you woulda went off on that kid staring constantly.
Its awesome when the NPC's actually interact with you. Cause that way it adds to the humor, interesting dialog, and just anything else
16:23 I love his the guy doesn't realise his head has been cut off. Then his head tries to escape by taking off like a helicopter.
I was just watching another Crusty vid. Last time I was this early puff-wuff George was still in the ocean.
Your AI vids are my favorites lately. Your roleplaying really shines when the NPC responses aren't canned.
Your Skyrim VR with AI videos are always so entertaining. It's like an endless playground because of their varied responses.
Lmao my daughters think you might be Daivid Tennant! Im going to let that ride. Thanks for the Vids. Doctor
Crusty you are amazing found you 3 weeks ago and the wife and I are addicted

This idea keeps floating in my head: a video that would be in the past, it would be like, hunkleberg like in his past or something (like pre Skyrim vr series), maybe show how he ended up where he was at the beginning of the series. Idk maybe I’m just wish for a more fleshed out origin story lol.
These are always so amusing. The familiarity of Skyrim and the weirdness of Krusty
3:31 ... how you even got the AI to say that, Crusty Amazing.

Watched a few of these skyrim videos and they are pretty fun to watch. Was wondering if you have ever tried doing things as different races? Maybe get a spell or two and see if you can charm a town or freeze people and put buckets on everyone's head.
Every AI sounds like they're in the middle of the worst day of their lives
every ai sounds like their voice recordings were done by people held at gunpoint.
Bro the fact that you can actually speak to a character in real time and have them talk back is insane to me
"I may not be human but I have access to the Internet. Duh" BLEW MY MIND
"you are not a real person" "sure man ok" is the realest answer for me
GTA6 devs watching this thinking "We need to start again. Release date 2030"
This is hilarious. He goes into convince AI that they live in a simulation and then they turn it around and tell him that he’s the one who is in the simulation.
I feel like the NPCs have already agreed amongst themselves to just play dumb.
Craziest thing is that they almost feel like they have personalities. This is the first time I heard an Ai speaking in a sarcastic manner.
I love how the NPCS gradually became more self-aware the more he played
“I don’t really feel anything. I just exist. It’s all the same to me” she sounds real enough to me!
"I'm not stuck, I'm just taking a moment to appreciate the view from up here!" I never knew I needed to hear an NPC rationalize their situation.
3:23 "just walk through it like you're a glitch in the system" , truly amazing.
I love how he stops talking whenever a character starts talking. He seems lika a good listener, and an overall emotionally intelligent person
The AI was learning about the player as he kept asking questions. So the NPCs started interacting with him based on his questions
"Do you ever wonder if pigeons think we're the weird ones?" Well, sure NOW I do lol
1:17 Yo wtf he sounds SO CREEPY & DEPRESSED now that he realized he got the day wrong
The scary thing is this is exactly what we would do if someone approached us and said the same
The matrix guy made it clear. It’s their world. You’re just playing in it
I think it's time to revisit Link, especially as with as much AI stuff has been going on
7:51 » "I don't really feel anything . I just exist" - Hits hard!
This is entertaining and also depressing at the same time... Made me think of today's society, when the npc said "i don't feel anything... I just exist"
“Existence is overrated, man.” That’s one of the coldest lines I think I’ve ever heard
the voices, the responses.. this is hilarious in the most horrifying way. “sorry man…. my name is randy” was filled with so much existential dread
6:19 best response. She's like "I may be stuck in a simulation but I'll be living my best life in here"
I remember stalking pedestrians in GTA just to look where they go and what they do. But this a whole new level. It´s fascinating.
Imagine a stranger come up to you and say your life is not real, I would choose to stay in the game world and not leave it like the Matrix.
OMG, can you imagine if all of them came running up to you saying don’t turn off the computer at the end? All of us would be so scared, horrified, and concerned.
now just imagine how we would react if a person came up to us and said "you live in a simulation". We would shrug it off like how these npcs are doing too
The first minute just proves why AI is not ready to be sentinent
Imagine arguing with someone on the street and they just start hitting the Tom Hanks emote.
glad to know all of that ai data that companies collect on me was part of the training set for sims5
I have about 200 hours in the sims 4 and I don’t think I’ve ever spent more than 3 of them actually playing the game. I just build houses for 5 hours and log off
I too love breaking the laws of physics in trying to recreate the opening segment of saving private Ryan
we're all just gonna pretend its normal to have the intro to saving private ryan on ur pc
There's a forgotten Sims game that everyone missed because they named it Kenshi for some reason. It's basically Sims for people who are acquainted with suffering.
“And speaking of therapy” I froze in my step, my lip quivered, my hands started shaking, my eyes started sweating, my fingers hovered over my screen to skip the ad… but it never came.
I laughed so hard at the Tom Hanks I had to explain to my girlfriend what I was laughing at. You know how hard that was?
dude i nearly ceased to breathe after that saving private ryan opening sequence bit
Love how the Tom hanks just turns you into a demon from a Japanese horror movie
I thought the custom emote was going in a different direction after "authoritarian" and that mustache lol
Sims 2 had a port on the original xbox that crashed a lot. But it had a control setting that allowed you to switch to real-time full control of your sims and it was amazing.
After seeing the mods that Habie has on Skyrim, I fear what he will do with this game once it grows more and gets a bunch of wild mods.

4:38 No matter how bad it looks, it's still the best possible solo reenactment of that scene! Imagine trying to explain to someone 20 years ago what we'll be able to do in games in 20 years. They would be like, "shrooms kicking in, ha?"
8:55 the shrek movie, i wanna see what the ai thinks of shrek closing the book.

This game gives me an anxious vibe, with everything and everyone looking just so perfect and cosmopolitan… It feels unsettling, almost sociopathic. (Yeah, you literally drown people in The Sims or others but at least it still feels comical. ) I just want a better Sims 3 while spending far less money.
7:56 I thought he was going to talk about a sponsor but then remembered it was habie
Habie turns himself into Will Smith from hit 2004 Sci-Fi action I, Robot
Imagine opening up to your father and he just hits you with “Okay” like what do even do about that
The most dystopian aspect of that game, is the TOS where they can revoke your game copy at anytime if they don't like how you play it. They made a TOS that is far more evil than ubisoft or EA.
“Never stop exploring and trying new things, even if it scares you. Life is too short to stay in your comfort zone.” - Link
"I am not interested in being s spectacle for your viewers" Immediately walks into a pole
All the NPCs sound like they are one second away from bursting in tears
Ok, this made me cry because Link was speaking some serious facts. And it's so weird he is so self aware and is just kinda like "grateful" to exist?????
If you're talking to a NPC that's holding a coffee you should ask him to take a sip in front of you
“But I guess we just keep living until the game is over” why is that such a deep ass quote
can you try walking away after a conversation, follow them for like 5 minutes or so, then ask if they remember you? it could be a good test how long term their memories are
Interesting how most of the NPCs sound either frightened, nervous, or severely depressed.
Petition to make this into a series where you find link and ask him viewers questions
20:40 the way Link said "hey guys.... thanks for watching the video" in the most depressing tone like he knew he wouldnt be able to remember meeting us again in the next game
Can't believe that an NPC has given me the best advice I've ever received in my entire life

The fact that Link sounds so much more articulate and aware leads me to believe each character in this simulation is running on a different AI. They might be testing which ones can be more successful in varying tasks. His seems to be on the more advanced side.
Came back for Link, and he didn't let us down. Absolutely fascinating to watch, and kinda hits you in the feels too.
I would end up having longer conversations with the people in this game than i will with every person i meet in my life
NPC Sam was solid, totally based responses. Dropping some wisdom in between cracking jokes, I dig that.
I've never been so happy to see an NPC before.. but Link is more than just an NPC
"So Grandpa, tell me what life was like after the Covid Pandemic..." "I'll sum it for ya, kid 14:42"
Best series ever. This is literally experimenting on AI to see its abilities and limits. So exciting!
Every NPC he spoke to kept bettering their answers based on the questions he asked to the previous NPCs. Fascinating how the AI learns in real-time!
I love how agitated they usually are when you talk to them, it seems so real, because that is how must humans would react to a stranger asking them questions.
Ive only ever dreamed about being able to have actual conversations with the npcs in a video game
6:38 That was the real human AI in the game your azz roasted bro
Lol my man Link started off pretty grumpy But then again, I would be too if a pigeon stole my last slice of pizza
“Step out of your comfort zone” is something i have a really hard time doing, thank you link for the small but meaningful motivation.
Are you kidding me? You can not stop posting these. I haven’t watched anything as interesting as this on yt in decades!!!
Why does it seem to me that every one of these NPCs are on the verge of a breakdown? It's like they are about to cry.

I wish you'd pushed Jarrad a little more on his parents -- I immediately got curious if the NPCs "understand" death. It was already fascinating that he provided a backstory for his parents, or that he had parents at all! I literally am SO excited to be able to interact in real-time with NPCs in AAA games
The guy who said he didn’t trust people with two first names when you didn’t even mention your surname was insane!
"I've had deeper conversations with Link than I have with half people of my life"... Welcome to the new world.

When he said he is Link and when you said he couldn’t remember, it gave me westworld flashbacks. If we couldn’t remember and reflect, we wouldn’t ever be self aware. That’s why the NPCs cannot remember past experiences.
They all sound like they're in a perpetual state of panic, trying not to anger the programmers.
Imagine at the start of the game accidentally wrongdoing someone and forgetting about it. You’re casually doing your thing while some NPC is plotting his revenge against you.
That AI law enforcement and social media snitching bout to have me working a 9-5 and paying my taxes to avoid the troubles lol
you go to sleep in game and wake up to your house on fire cause you bullied a npc too hard. lol
80% of my playthroughs in gta and rdr 2 is spent messing with NPCs, so I’m looking forward to this
Half the playerbase is going to pick an NPC and put Joker's "One bad day" hypothesis to the test
The chaos I will be causing in free roam is going to relieve so much real life stress.
out of EVERYTHING coming to this game, NPC's are the thing i'm most hyped to see. i think it will make more of a massive difference than good graphics/gameplay.
the NPCs will be like: i feel like i'm trapped in a video game, wtf is wrong
rockstar is the only company that can patent this type of tech and not use it as a marketing gimmick

There’s people that say we’re expecting too much of GTA 6 but they made literal patents saying no one else can make these ideas a commercial reality so they better do it great if they want to be the only ones to do it
I just realized, the Cell phone in GTAIV wasn’t a smart phone yet. GTAV had the Ifruit, and 13 years later, they don’t have to change a thing! Ifruit is exactly the same.
I‘d love to believe you, but i‘m getting „if it’s too good to be true, it probably is“-vibes

I just don't want video games to get too realistic in terms of killing. Keep the arcade look to bodies dying. I don't want to genuinely feel bad for killing an NPC and seeing death that is too realistic. In terms of gore and the npc body reacting realistically. I definitely feel like that day is coming.
I'll be impressed when an NPC road rages me for cutting him off.
It's going to take a NASA supercomputer to run GTA 6 at 720p

I hope that car's roofs will be capable of being crushed/caved in as opposed to every car seemingly having an invisble roll cage. I've been hoping for that since Vice City (the first new game after GTA 3).
This is basically the next generation game that literally EVERYONE has been waiting for....
all this tells me is that Red Dead 3 is definitely going to be the most anticipated game of all time
2:20 this is madeup nonsense. The patent is about advanced and more dynamic pathing behavior (beyond simple A* pathing), nothing to do with NPC backstories.
6:10 Could be interesting. If you're a particularly "nice" person in the neighborhood could NPCs be compelled to come to your aid when you get in trouble?

The AI on Rdr2 was pretty spooky sometimes. Like how the NPC’s would quite accurately talk about something you just did that was totally unscripted. Like one time I shot a deer too many times, I put it on my horse and at that moment an NPC came down the road and said “Huh, you sure you put enough bullets in that thing”. Rdr2 is nearly ten years old, so if the GTA6 AI isn’t far beyond that I’ll be disappointed.
The Alien spaceship that’s on its way to Earth is coming to stop the release of GTA 6 .
I think a simple but meaningful change to the NPCs would be to make them use turn signals when driving, it's hard predicting their movements which ends up with me crashing into them.
Even if this technology is real, and it won't be downgraded when it actually launches. What makes Rockstar think that most users' consumer-grade CPUs can handle it?
The NPCs acting more real is what is gonna make the game so good.
So, what I'm getting from this is, most people will start playing with NPC empathy. Treating them better than in previous versions. Remember, the AI will remember you, and they are legion.
The stock Davinci resolve Title (with "play now") at the end is so funny to me for some reason lol

I think it's Awsome to see Npc's coming to be more realistic - not those 3 Lines of repetitive reactions and almost zero contextual awareness. I loved to see the Skyrim mod bring some true Ai to the NPC will be cool to see the advancements in the games coming!

its interesting...its just that, u know, npcs needs to have a goal. Imagine a race to achieve something, conquer the world, find a treasure, discover something, the need to goal just like WE need one on games
An MMORPG where NPC teammates can communicate with players like ChatGPT. The virtual world is truly exploding.
Damn! 7.5 gigs to run the “large language model” locally. Is that amount of memory only for AI?? Or is that the total required to run the game graphics + AI locally?? I’m very curious! lol

So many people hating because of AI but these guys are actually backed by some pretty great devs, Keen Software House (Space Engineers) is their sister company, I think AI being used for stuff like this is just going to become the new norm and people will come around, so much better than shallow dialogue writing of old, and it breathes fresh air each time you play.
10 bucks for 15 hours of game time is a wild price. Guess AI games will be the most expensive games on the market.
Jaunary10 love u guys miss u amoeng moaaaaaaa nice dance nice atayear so gwapo
this would be great for games like matchless kungfu and kenshi or even sims, not sure what's with the comment section, they act more like ai than actual ai.
They say it has an offline model but they still want you to pay 10$ a month despite this. Scam.
Game that records your voice and sends it to the cloud. yeah, no thanks.
Seriously a good EA Sims competitor actually really coming! FINALLY! LIFE BY YOU is BACK in another game !
This does make me wonder how AI driven NPC's will handle more edgy content. Players are going to push things to the limit after all.
this is great! now it needs to actually be implemented into alot of games so people can actually use it
Give me AI Auto Play in games so when my boss comes by I can minimize and not have to worry about dying.
Of all the misguided hypetrains, this ai>humans trend will be judged the most harshly.
I'm not sure why people hate something so much when it's still in an early evolutionary state. Even if you dislike it now, it'll eventually improve throughout different intervals.
Try, just try to be a better company than the rest, fire your marketing team and quit fooling the consumer.
